hr.fer.zemris.java.raytracer

Class Tracer

  • java.lang.Object
    • hr.fer.zemris.java.raytracer.Tracer

  • public class Tracer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used for calculation of each pixel's RGB components.
    After initialization with given Scene and required vectors, method calculatePixelRGB(int, int, short[]) can be called for any pixel (point) within the screen.
    Phong reflection model and Ray-casting algorithm are used.
    Author:
    Dan

      void calculatePixelRGB(int x, int y, short[] rgb)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tracer

        public Tracer(hr.fer.zemris.java.raytracer.model.Scene scene,
              hr.fer.zemris.java.raytracer.model.Point3D eye,
              hr.fer.zemris.java.raytracer.model.Point3D view,
              hr.fer.zemris.java.raytracer.model.Point3D viewUp,
              double horizontal,
              double vertical,
              int width,
              int height)
        Creates a new Tracer with given arguments.
        Parameters:
        scene - Scene containing GraphicalObjects and LightSources.
        eye - Point of the observer.
        view - Position that is observed; center of the screen.
        viewUp - Specification of view-up vector which is used to determine y-axis for the screen.
        horizontal - Horizontal width of the observed space.
        vertical - Vertical height of the observed space.
        width - Number of pixels per screen row.
        height - Number of pixels per screen column.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the view-up vector is collinear with the eye-view vector

    • Method Detail

      • calculatePixelRGB

        public void calculatePixelRGB(int x,
                              int y,
                              short[] rgb)
        Calculates RGB components of given pixel from the observed space, based on the scene.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of the pixel
        y - y coordinate of the pixel
        rgb - array for result storage with length at least 3
